Description:
FAMILY CHARISMA IN AN EXCLUSIVE POCKET
Hidden from view, this Kennington property offers resort-style living in a prestige location. A private driveway leads to a boutique home boasting three living zones and six bedrooms over two levels (about 46 squares). The lower level offers wing style accommodation to suit extended family or guests. Separate access makes the lower level ideal for an approved home-based business.
Highlights in this architect-designed home include Queensland Tallowwood flooring, purpose built theatre room, upper-level balcony and stack-back doors with superior ComfortPlus glazing. A special mention for the main suite, it has double doors, walk-in dressing and a superb ensuite bathroom, enjoy twin vanities, party shower, central staircase, glass balustrade, walk-in robes in all bedrooms, banquet sized dining and fully-appointed kitchen. A cook's dream is realised with a substantial butler's pantry, 900mm-wide Baumatic cooker, Bosch dishwasher, family diner, bar fridge and drinks station.
Split level, the family living zone overlooks the merbau decking and unique solar-heated swimming pool with soothing waterfall. The house and pool are designed to enhance the elevation of the land and so the pool is level with the home's second storey. Land size measures approximately 850 square metres with electronic gates, four-car garage, store room, trailer bay and tropical-inspired gardens.
The property has data cabling, sound system, ducted climate control, electronic gates and a 2.2 kw solar system.
Set so close to Strath Village shopping centre, La Trobe University & Bendigo's thriving CBD, this remarkable home backs on to One Tree Hill Reserve for ongoing privacy & absolute tranquility.

Description:
PRESTIGIOUS PROPERTY WITH RESERVOIR VIEWS
This spectacular home, located in a prestigious court with views over Kennington Reservoir, has been beautifully designed to make excellent use of the approx. 1099sq m block.
The impressive entry opens onto a formal living space – making the most of those sensational views – and leads to a study (or fourth bedroom) and a substantial living, dining and kitchen space. This unique area offers two living spaces in one: with a nook ideal for a small library or lounge and private deck to one side of the room. The rest of this bright, open space is perfect for entertaining with a modern kitchen, dining and lounge all opening onto a large decked barbeque area.
Alpine ash floors set the scene for the quality fittings throughout the house including ducted heating and cooling, split systems and a vacuum system. In the kitchen you will find quality Bosch appliances including a double oven and five burner gas cooktop along with ample cupboard space.
Down the hallway, discover two more additional bedrooms, both with built-in robes and a magnificent master suite complete with walk-through robe, a private deck and a large ensuite with double vanity and a generous shower.
The main bathroom also offers two vanities, shower and a sizeable, modern freestanding bathtub. At the end of the hall is a large laundry with double built-in robes and additional cupboard space under the bench. A substantial linen cupboard is built-in to the hallway adding to the abundance of storage options. Access to the clothesline and an outside courtyard can be made via the laundry, or the three-car garage beyond.
The spotless triple garage features an additional space that is fully plumbed and fenced allowing room for a spa, bar or additional bathroom area. Finally, even more storage is available beyond the garage with a small room perfect for housing bikes, golf clubs or set up as a workshop, and this is accessible from both the driveway or rear courtyard.
The spectacular landscaping throughout the yard and the many external decked areas has clearly been well-considered offering drought-tolerant plants such as olive trees and succulents, in addition to a fully-fitted drip system for easy watering. The asphalt driveway leading from the front of the block up to the garage at the rear creates a private lane way and allows access at every level to various parts of the home.
This unique and timeless home is simply magnificent – offering privacy, luxury and so much more.

Description:
LOVELY HOME IN A GREAT LOCATION
Nestled in a quiet street within easy walking distance to schools, childcare, Kennington Reservoir and Strath Village, this appealing solid brick residence delivers light-filled and impressively presented single-storey living.
A neat and spacious front garden, with established trees and plants, features a concrete and brick drive leading down to a carport at the rear of the block. The steel front fence and gate provide security and safety and the large, lawn yard offers plenty of space for children’s play.
Entering through the front door, you will find a lovely light tiled entry hall, which opens on to the main areas of the home via three doorways including an original, character archway.
Leading to one side is a relaxing lounge with a large window and ceiling fan. The home also features evaporative cooling and ducted heating throughout.
To the other side of the entry is a bedroom, which is currently utilised as a study. With dual access and built-in robes, this is space could also potentially be used as an additional living space.
Heading down the main hallway you will find two further good-sized bedrooms, both with built-in robes and large windows offering plenty of natural light.
The modern family bathroom has benefitted from a recent refurbishment providing a spotless and well-presented area in stylish, neutral tones.
From the bathroom is access to a separate toilet, which can also be reached from the spacious laundry on the other side. The laundry features great built-in storage and access to the kitchen and dining room.
The tiled kitchen and dining room provides lots of room and ample cupboard space. The modern restoration features classic colours and all contemporary conveniences including a built-in microwave and convection oven as well as an electric oven and four-burner gas cooktop.
With space for a double fridge and an air conditioner, this great space has been practically designed for ease of use.
A door from the dining area leads out to neat backyard with an undercover, paved brick space – perfect for entertaining. A colourbond fence and gate provides easy access through to the front yard, as well as ensuring privacy.
A lawn area and lush fernery opens on to a second paved al fresco area – the perfect sun trap on cold winter days – with clothesline and a gate that takes you back through to the carport and driveway on the other side of the home.
Back inside, heading through the kitchen to the main lounge you can step down to the rear of the property in to a light and spacious room. This area is currently being utilised as a fantastic master suite and offers a four-door built-in robe, air conditioning, heating and a large sliding door opening out to the rear of the property. This room could easily be used as a large second living area, further providing a flexible layout, which could be configured in a number of ways to perfectly suit a prospective buyer.
This charming 1950s era brick home is beautifully presented, features a quality solid build in an excellent location with a flexible layout. Ideal for a young family, it could also offer fantastic rental potential for an investment buyer.
